properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 4 at 4:54AM PST until January 4 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW THROUGH SATURDAY IN THE CASCADE MOUNTAINS...

.Several rounds of moderate to heavy snow will impact the Cascade
Crest this weekend into next week. Additional accumulations of 4
to 8 inches are expected at Stevens Pass today. More snow is
expected Sunday through the middle of next week with periods of
moderate to heavy accumulations along the Cascade Crest including
Stevens Pass.

* WHAT...Snow expected for The Cascade Crest including Highway 2
between Coles Corner and Stevens Pass. Additional snow
accumulations of 4 to 8 inches expected today.

* WHERE...Stehekin and Holden Village.

* WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Treacherous driving conditions on Highway 2 from Coles
Corner to Stevens Pass. Mountain recreation will be locally
dangerous in the Cascades today. Strong winds on the mountain
ridges will produce localized areas of blowing snow, reduced
visibility, and bitterly cold wind chills.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A series of weather systems will bring
periods of moderate to heavy snow to the Cascades this weekend
into next week. If you have plans to travel over the Cascade
Passes the next several days, monitor road reports closely.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE CASCADE CREST INCLUDING HIGHWAY 2 BETWEEN COLES CORNER AND STEVENS PASS
